intro: Stipularia flaccida, commonly known as the flaccid stipularia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Orchidaceae family, known for its delicate and often fragrant blooms. The plant typically features slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, with a distinctive appearance that resembles a cluster of tiny bells. Stipularia flaccida thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grassy or open habitats.
